channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The art of debate is thriving in one unlikely place: prisons
item.description: An Oregon penitentiary is showcasing its inmates' debating skills. They make arguments, speak to others' perspectives and resolve disputes amicably.
item.content:encoded: An Oregon penitentiary is showcasing its inmates' debating skills. They make arguments, speak to others' perspectives and resolve disputes amicably.
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Camhi

item.title: Trump's 'cardiac age' is 14 years younger. What does that mean?
item.description: The President's "cardiac age" has been reported to be 14 years younger than his chronological age. What does this mean, and who can get this test?
item.content:encoded: The President's "cardiac age" has been reported to be 14 years younger than his chronological age. What does this mean, and who can get this test?
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Progressive Christians counter Christian Nationalism message
item.description: Many Christians are worried that the rise of Christian Nationalism — the idea that the U.S. government should be ruled by Christian beliefs — is doing harm to their religion.
item.content:encoded: Many Christians are worried that the rise of Christian Nationalism — the idea that the U.S. government should be ruled by Christian beliefs — is doing harm to their religion.
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: Is Congress willing to curb Trump's approach to executive power?
item.description: President Trump's expansive interpretation of executive power is continuing to reshape federal spending in a government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's expansive interpretation of executive power is continuing to reshape federal spending in a government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: New festival in Portland honors York, an enslaved member of Lewis and Clark's team
item.description: Portland launches York Fest, an event to honor an enslaved Black man named York who entered what is now Oregon as part of the Lewis and Clark expedition.
item.content:encoded: Portland launches York Fest, an event to honor an enslaved Black man named York who entered what is now Oregon as part of the Lewis and Clark expedition.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Scientists make yogurt using ants. The result: tangy and herby
item.description: Scientists test a traditional method for fermenting yogurt... using ants.
item.content:encoded: Scientists test a traditional method for fermenting yogurt... using ants.
item.dc:creator: Regina G. Barber

item.title: Eric Lu is the first American winner of the Chopin Competition in 55 years
item.description: American Eric Lu is the newest winner of the prestigious International Chopin Piano Competition held in Warsaw, Poland.
item.content:encoded: American Eric Lu is the newest winner of the prestigious International Chopin Piano Competition held in Warsaw, Poland.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam

item.title: Lessons on love from 'meet cutes' in New York
item.description: Ever see two people and wonder, are they a couple? Aaron Feinberg, a co-creator of Meet Cutes NYC, takes this question head-on in his spontaneous interviews on the streets of New York and new book.
item.content:encoded: Ever see two people and wonder, are they a couple? Aaron Feinberg, a co-creator of Meet Cutes NYC, takes this question head-on in his spontaneous interviews on the streets of New York and new book.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: At this 'tree rodeo,' utility arborists compete getting trees off of power lines
item.description: When you hear "tree rodeo," you may expect people lassoing branches. But in this event, arborists for utility companies show off the skills that allow them to safely remove trees from power lines.
item.content:encoded: When you hear "tree rodeo," you may expect people lassoing branches. But in this event, arborists for utility companies show off the skills that allow them to safely remove trees from power lines.
item.dc:creator: Amy Feiereisel

item.title: Antidepressant side effects differ depending on the drug, study finds
item.description: Researchers in the U.K. have published a major review of published data on physical side effects related to antidepressants such as changes in weight, blood pressure and heart rate.
item.content:encoded: Researchers in the U.K. have published a major review of published data on physical side effects related to antidepressants such as changes in weight, blood pressure and heart rate.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone
